perturbation.original_text: 1.1  "Customer" means a person or entity that has acquired, or has indicated its      interest in acquiring from Licensee, or from a Redistributor if so      specified herein, a non-exclusive and nontransferable Sublicense to use one      (1) or more of the Licensed Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  "Customer" means a person or entity that has acquired from Licensee a non-exclusive and nontransferable Sublicense to use one (1) or more of the Licensed Products. Any entity only showing interest does not qualify as a 'Customer'.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes entities that have 'indicated interest' in acquiring a sublicense. The modified definition explicitly excludes them, creating a contradiction. This impacts marketing efforts, where leads that demonstrate an interest are now not consider customers.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 8.1    Licensor shall be solely responsible for delivering to Licensee a Master Copy of each Licensed Product and Documentation and for the maintenance and support of the Sublicense Copies and Documentation used by any Redistributors and Customers.  The duties of Licensor include the following:

     (a)  Delivering a Master Copy of each Licensed Product and Documentation,           including any Upgrades as they become available, to permit Licensee to           (1) make Sublicense Copies and copies of the Documentation to meet the           demand of Redistributors and Customers and (2) market and license           Sublicense Copies and copies of the Documentation, together with the           copies of promotional and other materials which Licensor may produce           from time to time in order to assist Licensee in marketing and           sublicensing the Licensed Products during the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 8.1    Licensor may, at its discretion, assist Licensee in the delivery of a Master Copy of each Licensed Product and Documentation and may provide maintenance and support of the Sublicense Copies and Documentation used by any Redistributors and Customers if resources allow.  The duties of Licensor may include the following, subject to resource availability:

     (a)  Delivering a Master Copy of each Licensed Product and Documentation,           including any Upgrades as they become available, subject to resource constraints, to permit Licensee to           (1) make Sublicense Copies and copies of the Documentation to meet the           demand of Redistributors and Customers and (2) market and license           Sublicense Copies and copies of the Documentation, together with the           copies of promotional and other materials which Licensor may produce           from time to time in order to assist Licensee in marketing and           sublicensing the Licensed Products during the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the licensor 'shall' be solely responsible for delivery and maintenance, while the changed version introduces 'may' and 'if resources allow', making their responsibility discretionary. This conflicts with other clauses which rely on Licensor's obligations regarding the master copies and upgrades.

perturbation.original_text: Section 12.2   PERFORMANCE.  For twelve (12) months after delivery of any Licensed Product to a Customer, whether Customer receives such Licensed Product from Licensee or a Redistributor, Licensor warrants that each Licensed Product will perform as described in the applicable Documentation.  If Licensee or any Redistributor or Customer discovers any errors or discrepancies in the Licensed Products from the Documentation during the twelve (12) month warranty period, Licensee shall notify Licensor promptly in writing of such error or discrepancy in sufficient detail to enable Licensor to recreate the error or discrepancy.  If the error or discrepancy is found by Licensee prior to the expiration of the ten (10) day evaluation period set forth in Section 4.2, such evaluation period shall be extended ten (10) days from the date of receipt by Licensee of the corrected Licensed Product from Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 12.2   PERFORMANCE.  For twelve (12) months after delivery of any Licensed Product to a Customer, whether Customer receives such Licensed Product from Licensee or a Redistributor, Licensor warrants that each Licensed Product will perform as described in the applicable Documentation, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Licensee.  If Licensee or any Redistributor or Customer discovers any errors or discrepancies in the Licensed Products from the Documentation during the twelve (12) month warranty period, Licensee shall notify Licensor promptly in writing of such error or discrepancy in sufficient detail to enable Licensor to recreate the error or discrepancy.  If the error or discrepancy is found by Licensee prior to the expiration of the ten (10) day evaluation period set forth in Section 4.2, this warranty shall not be applicable and governed under Section 4.2 instead.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a clear warranty for 12 months. The changed version introduces an exception 'unless otherwise agreed in writing', creating uncertainty and contradicting the clear warranty. Also, there is an exception that during the initial evaluation period, instead of extending it, section 4.2 overrules it.
